newsitem.title: CANADA: Bank of Canada sets specials at 3.25 percent.
newsitem.headline: Bank of Canada sets specials at 3.25 percent.

text.p: The Bank of Canada on Friday conducted a round of special purchase and resale agreements in the money market at 3.25 percent, dealers said.
The central bank intervened after the call loan, or overnight lending rate, traded at the top of the Bank of Canada's 2.75-3.25 percent target range, dealers said.
"It wasn't trading higher than a quarter but there just wasn't a lot of money available. It doesn't really have a lot of impact," said one Toronto-based T-bill trader.
It was only the second session this month that the Bank of Canada has intervened on money markets. The Bank of Canada set two rounds of specials on December 2.
The call loan rate continued to trade at 3.25 percent following the intervention. Canada's three-month when-issued bill traded at 2.94 percent.
